description.narrative:
Den föreslagna åtgärden är ett femårigt stöd som syftar till att öka Moldaviens konkurrenskraft under perioden 2016-2020 med en budget på uppskattningsvis 43 miljoner kronor (5 miljoner USD). Det svenska bidraget är en samfinansiering av den pågående USAID Moldavien konkurrenskraftsprojekt (MCP) som lanserades 2015. Projektet genomförs av Chemonics, ett amerikanskt konsultföretag som kontrakterats av USAID. USAID ger finansieringen av 16,8 miljoner USD. Den totala budgeten, inklusive alla deltagare, uppskattas till 187 miljoner kronor (cirka 22 miljoner USD).
Syftet med konkurrenskraftsprojektet är att främja en stark, mångsidig och exportorienterad ekonomi genom att utveckla viktig konkurrens och växande industrier i Moldavien. Bidraget kommer att bygga vidare på framgångarna och dynamiken i USAID:s tidigare arbete och stödja regeringen i Moldaviens strategi för export- och investerings - driven tillväxt genom att fokusera på: • Ökad produktivitet och kvalitet • Utvidga marknadskontakter och handel; • Förbättrad branschgynnsam miljö.

The proposed intervention is a five-year support aimed at enhancing Moldova’s competitiveness during the period of 2016-2020 with an estimated budget of 43 MSEK (5 Million USD). The Swedish contribution is a co-financing of the on-going USAID Moldova Competitiveness Project (MCP) launched in 2015. The Project is implemented by Chemonics, a US Consultancy company contracted by USAID. USAID provides funding of 16.8 Million USD. The total budget, including all contributors, is estimated at 187 Million SEK (about 22 Million USD).
The Overall Development Objective of the Project is to promote a strong, diverse and export-oriented economy. This will be achieved by focusing on the development of key competitive and growth-ready industries in the Republic of Moldova through their increased productivity and quality, expanded market linkages and improved sector-enabling environment. The Project is going to support the selected industries to reach a maturity level that ensures sustainable improvements in sector competitiveness and that provides well-paying and desirable jobs. It is expected that population’ incomes will increase and, therefore, produce a poverty alleviation effect with labour force emigration being reduced

participating-org.narrative: USAID/United States Agency for International Development

tag.narrative: 1.4 - By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.

1.4 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla män och kvinnor, i synnerhet de fattiga och de utsatta, har lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, tillgång till grundläggande tjänster, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till arv, naturresurser, lämplig ny teknik och finansiella tjänster, inklusive mikrokrediter.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.
8.2 - Achieve higher levels of economic productivity through diversification, technological upgrading and innovation, including through a focus on high-value added and labour-intensive sectors.
8.2 - Uppnå högre ekonomisk produktivitet genom diversifiering, teknisk uppgradering och innovation, bland annat genom att fokusera på sektorer med högt förädlingsvärde och hög arbetsintensitet.

8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

title.narrative: Arrangement between USAID and SIDA in support of the MCP
Beslut om Insats "USAID Competitiveness Enhancement Project 160212

description.narrative: During the fourth year of implementation (third year since Sweden joined), the Moldova Competitiveness Project has continued to exceed the expected results in many areas. The complete recount of the achievements made can be found in the ‘Year Four Annual Report FY19 – October 1, 2018 – September 30, 2019’ which is available on Open Aid. In brief, the MCP has achieved the following results up to the end of the fourth year of operations: - Technical assistance was extended to an additional 143 Small and Medium Enterprises (SME) totalling 760 during the fourth year (FY19), which is already 10% more than target of 700 SMEs for the whole project period. Of those enterprises, were one third (248) women-owned. The technical assistance included support to the SMEs and their business association which enabled them to; adopt new technologies aligned to Western and EU standards to improve product quality; increase access to domestic markets and internationally including taking advantage of the benefits from the Deeper and Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with the EU (DCFTA) ; make investments in equipment and skills development. - New investments generated by MCP-assisted firms add up to USD 201 million (USD 66 million in FY19). The investments made, after MCP provided technical assistance and advisory, have been used for upgrades to production facilities, new equipment and product quality improvements. - The project’s SME innovation fund, which provide small grants in the range of USD 5 to 50 thousands, has leveraged investments in new technologies to improve product quality needed to get access to higher-value markets. According to the project’s estimates, for every USD 1 invested by the SME innovation fund, the beneficiaries – enterprises have invested USD 3,3 themselves. All in all, the project have provided 147 innovation grants worth USD 5 million to Business Associations, Industry Excellence Centres, STEM (Science, Technology and Matts) skills programmes and SME quality upgrades. - As a direct results of MCP-assisted trade initiatives, domestic and export sales increased by USD 188 million in FY19 (USD 364 million across the four year period). Most of the exports were to the EU. - Of the 248 women-owned SMEs, 134 were in textile and fashion industry, 55 in tourism, 40 in agriculture and 19 in IT. The support, in terms of inclusive development, has been especially important for the textile and fashion industry, where in Moldova, every second company is owned or managed by a woman. The project’s assistance to this sector has helped in improving product quality and increased export, but also had a positive impact in improving working conditions and increased wages. For instance MCP-assisted firms increased the wages of seamstresses by 20-50 percent, up to USD 520 per month, compared to the country textile industry average of USD 310. - In tourism, the MCP project supported the establishment of a tourism business association ANTRIM. ANTRIM has increased their presence in strategic development of the tourism industry over the past few years. Today it has 48 members which counts for 80% of the inbound tourism sector. The project strategy is to target selected areas in the country which are deemed to have the largest tourism potential. As part of this strategy, technical assistance and small grants have been provided to 5 new rural guesthouses in FY19 (14 in total in the project so far). These guest houses hosted about 36,000 visitors in 2019, which is a 20 percent increase compared to 2018. 19 new rural Bead and Breakfast’s were also given up-grade assistance. These are thought to serve as ‘prototypes’ for other similar initiatives in the country geared towards tourism from mainly Europe.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
